intro: Stisseria bufonia, commonly known as the yellow sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family, which includes many species with showy, often tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and dry slopes. Its yellow flowers are usually arranged in clusters and bloom during the spring and early summer. Stisseria bufonia is characterized by its hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves.
